author: Young Living

cleaned_text: Have you ever smelled fresh-baked bread, caught a whiff of perfume as someone walked by, or sniffed the scent of fresh flowers and found yourself instantly transported to a different time or place? Aromas are powerful—they can transport us to different places, remind us of people, and trigger memories that were long forgotten. And through the practice of aromatherapy, scents can also support whole-life wellness. Whether you use essential oils just before bedtime, bathtime, or anytime you need a little TLC, their power-packed aromas promote overall well-being. What is aromatherapy? Aromatherapy is the practice of using essential oils topically and aromatically for overall wellness. [Essential oils](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/essential-oils-101-beginners-guide/) are a highly concentrated, natural oil produced from botanicals such as flowers, trees, roots, and seeds. According to the [Mayo Clinic](https://www.youngliving.com/us/en/product/madison-hand-sanitizer-holder), the scents from these potent, plant-based products "target smell receptors in the nose, triggering effects that pass through the nervous system to the brain." Those effects can help your body, mind, and emotional well-being in many ways. It often is paired with other complementary therapy, such as tai chi, yoga, acupuncture, massage therapy, spinal manipulation, art therapy, music therapy, and dance, among other therapies. When using essential oils for aromatherapy, it's important to choose [pure, high-quality oils](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/). Find out [where your oils come from](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/discover/seed-to-seal#sourcing) and [the testing they go through](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/discover/seed-to-seal#science) to make sure they [meet the highest standards](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/discover/seed-to-seal#standards). You want to [get the most out of every drop](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/using-essential-oils-on-a-budget/) of essential oil during your aromatherapy practice, so do your research! How do you use essential oils for aromatherapy? When people hear the word aromatherapy, they usually think of using essential oils aromatically—and for good reason! [Diffusers](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/products/c/diffusers-accessories/diffusers) disperse tiny oil droplets into the air, allowing you to easily surround yourself with the soothing scent of [Lavender](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/products/lavender-essential-oil) or the stimulating scent of [Citrus Fresh](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/products/citrus-fresh-essential-oil-blend). But you can also use oils topically in practice! Apply a drop of [Rosemary essential oil](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/products/rosemary-essential-oil) on your pressure points and enjoy its energizing aroma. Or add a few drops of [Ylang Ylang](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/products/ylang-ylang-essential-oil) to your massage oil to amp up the spa-like vibes. No matter your method, you're harnessing the power of essential oils! What are the benefits of aromatherapy? The benefits of aromatherapy are as varied as the constituents in essential oils. You can use aromatherapy for a more luxurious bathtime, a more relaxing bedtime, or a more energized work environment. Here are 10 different ways you can use essential oils for aromatherapy. The list includes over 60 different oils and [oil blends](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/products/c/essential-oil-products/blends)—try them all and you'll be an aromatherapy expert! Aromatherapy for mood Whether you start your diffuser the moment you wake up, put a drop of oil on your wrists as you head out the door, or incorporate essential oils into your massage routine, aromatherapy can be [great for your mood](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/). Here are a few oils you can try when you need a little change in outlook. For more ideas, check out the [7 essential oils happy people use](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/). Aromatherapy for relaxation When all you want to do is kick back and relax, aromatherapy is that best friend who brings the movie and popcorn. Diffuse any of these oils during your moments of R&R to boost the chill factor. Aromatherapy for bathtime We're firm believers in taking time for self-care. Aromatherapy during bathtime can soothe the body and the soul. Using essential oils in the bath is easy! Add 5-8 drops directly to the water as the tub fills or make your own [bath salts](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/diy-bath-salts/) or [bath bombs](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/diy-geode-bath-bombs/). For extra luxury—and moisture for your skin—mix 5-8 drops of oil in 2 tablespoons of [V-6](https://www.youngliving.com/us/en/product/v-6-vegetable-oil-complex) or coconut oil before adding to your bathwater. Aromatherapy for pregnancy Staying [relaxed throughout pregnancy](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/12-essential-oil-tips-for-a-relaxed-pregnancy/) is key to keeping you and baby happy! Those nine months are exciting yet stressful—outfitting the nursery, visiting the doctor, choosing a name. Make sure you take the time to pamper yourself with a little aromatherapy. Diffuse or dilute and apply these essential oils so you can [keep calm while carrying on](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/)!* Aromatherapy for massage Nothing relaxes muscles like a [great massage](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/). Throw essential oils into the mix and you'll really be living that spa life! Create a custom blend of oils and add it to some [V-6](https://www.youngliving.com/us/en/product/v-6-vegetable-oil-complex) or add a few drops of your favorite scent to one of our [many massage oils](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/products/c/essential-oil-products/massage-oils). Massage therapy + aromatherapy = Our bodies need sleep to stay healthy and happy—establishing a healthy [nighttime routine](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/) is key! According to the [Mayo Clinic](https://newsnetwork.mayoclinic.org/discussion/home-remedies-what-are-the-benefits-of-aromatherapy/), research suggests that incorporating aromatherapy during bedtime can help trigger your brain to know that it's time to snooze. You can go simple by adding a couple drops of your favorite settle-down scent to a cotton ball, or you can mix the oil in a spray bottle with distilled water and spritz it on your pillow. Aromatherapy for odor elimination Whether the smell of your homemade curry likes to stick around or your car stinks like soccer practice, essential oils are rock stars when it comes to eliminating odors. The following oils are our top picks for getting rid of nasty smells. You can use them in your diffuser or [DIY air fresheners](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/). Aromatherapy for focus Have a big project coming up? Dealing with reluctant homework-doers? Need to concentrate on a major goal? Find your focus with aromatherapy! The aromas of some essential oils can help create an environment that inspires you to get things done. Aromatherapy for kids If your goals are total wellness and a more relaxed life, you probably have similar goals for your kids. Little ones can benefit from aromatherapy, but it's a little different than aromatherapy for grownups. Before you get started, take some time to learn about the proper way to [dilute essential oils for children and babies](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/). Diffusing oils is pretty safe, but you'll want to take some precautions when applying them topically. Aromatherapy for pets Want to share aromatherapy with your furry, feathery, and scaly friends? You totally can! Before you begin, study [how to safely use essential oils around animals](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/essential-oils-for-pets-a-quick-how-to/), including the [dos and don'ts](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/) for each species. Additionally, work with your veterinarian to get their advice on your pet's needs. Once you're ready, these essential oil blends are formulated especially for the animals in your life. *Consult a health professional prior to use. **These oils are considered "hot" oils; please read label for dilution instructions. If the purpose for your aromatherapy practice is to recharge, try these [5 energizing essential oils](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/). Once refreshed and renewed, check out these [super creative ways to use essential oils](https://www.youngliving.com/blog/)—number 11 is our favorite!
